summary: Model Context Protocol (MCP) enables Cursor to connect to external tools and data sources. MCP servers can use stdio (local), SSE (server), or Streamable HTTP transport methods.
key_takeaways: MCP servers expose tools that Agent can use to interact with external systems.
Cursor supports Tools, Prompts, Resources, Roots, and Elicitation MCP features.
Agent asks for approval before using MCP tools by default.

questions.question: What file is used to configure MCP servers in a Cursor project?
questions.explanation: MCP servers are configured in .cursor/mcp.json for project-specific tools or ~/.cursor/mcp.json in your home directory for tools available everywhere.

questions.question: Which transport methods does Cursor support for MCP servers?
questions.explanation: Cursor supports three transport methods: stdio (local, managed by Cursor), SSE (server-sent events), and Streamable HTTP. Each has different deployment and authentication options.

questions.question: What variable syntax can you use in mcp.json to reference environment variables?
questions.explanation: Use ${env:NAME} syntax for environment variables in mcp.json. Other supported variables include ${userHome}, ${workspaceFolder}, and ${pathSeparator}.
